column2: Director of Medical and Scientific Affairs
column4: Responsible for providing scientific/technical for educational efforts, presenting scientific findings to all levels including Physicians, Research Staff and Sales and Marketing personnel. Presents data at key scientific meetings/conferences regarding company's products and participate as internal consultant to ensure that clinical utility of company's products meets clinical need. Works with Marketing and Research & Development to facilitate the effective transfer of relevant scientific and clinical information required to meet the needs and objectives of each group.
Oversees all relationships between department and outside vendors, supervises traffic and helps ensure the efficient/timely/cost-effective production of television and radio advertisements.
Responsible for managing department/team in support execution of all presentations, production, ads. Ensures appropriate levels and qualified staff and equipment necessary to complete projects.

Supervises traffic department. Responsible for ensuring traffic department efficiently and effectively manages all external coordination, expediting, and scheduling of all print/radio/TV. Provides consistent direction to traffic department and oversee the flow of work on all products and accounts, from concept development to product completion.

Leads Regulatory department; reports to either Director of Agency Operations or Chief Medical Officer. Ensures the department is aware of FDA standards, creates processes. Liaison to client promotion manager.
Responsible to the Head of Research and supervises the work and performance of one or more Associate Research Directors. Assists Director in overall management of the department.

The most senior member of the Account Planning structure. Overall responsibility for all agency planning activities and the operation of the planning & research department(s). Top level client contact.

The most senior person in account management, agency-wide. Responsible for all client activity. Selects and appoints specialists to account groups, and may conceive and execute special marketing services for specific clients. Top level client contact.

Overall corporate responsibility and accountability for the management of the total creative function of the agency office. Participates in setting agency goals and policy-making decisions. Establishes the “creative tone” and pace of the agency. Top level client contact. Typically a Vice President or above.
